record.dc:title: 101GP22, 15GP22, Greenup County, Kentucky. Hardin Village. Fire Pit, Feature 42.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Fort Ancient Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Close-up of firepit, Feature 42, partially excavated, showing rock in place. Nearly round, concave-bottomed pit, filled nearly to top by medium sized (8-24 cubic inches) burned and broken red sandstone. Interspersed among the rocks were numerous flecks of charcoal, and ashy dirt. This pit evidently was the site of a fire, or many fires, but the earth was neither hardened nor discoloured. Offset to north is an obviously intrusive post hole.
record.wpa:comments: More information, including diagram, available at institution.
